alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 1:45AM EST until December 19 at 8:38AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... East Branch Ausable River At Ausable Forks affecting Clinton and Essex Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...East Branch Ausable River at Ausable Forks. * WHEN...Until this morning. * IMPACTS...Until the river stage falls below 7.0 feet, minor flooding will continue in Keene. Water will continue to overflow onto Hulls Falls Road, Route 73, and Route 9N near Marcy Field. High water will continue to impact interests at Alice Falls near Keeseville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:25 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:25 AM EST Tuesday was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling to 2.7 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.7 feet on 12/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 845 AM EST.
